result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald J Tritz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to court costs.  PAID IN FULL.  Cash bail to be refunded to poster.  Court waives DNA surcharge and sample.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended as deemed appropriate by the Agent.

No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Domestic Violence Counseling and follow through as deemed appropriate by the Agent.
No violent contact with the victim listed in the criminal complaint.

records.addlTxt:
David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Ronald J Tritz in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.  
Victim notification has been complied with.

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.


Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation:  1 Year.
Concurrent to:  Case 15CF1275
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
DV Counseling and follow through as deemed appropriate by the agent.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended as deemed appropriate by the agent.
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No Violent contact with:  vicitm listed in the complaint.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Costs:  $243
DV Surcharge:  $100
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
Apply Bail and Refund Balance to the Posting Party.
